Question: You must NOT park on the right-hand side of the road, except when:

What is the closest distance your vehicle may be parked to a vehicle entrance?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive faster than 100km/h unless the road is clear
A rest area is 100 metres ahead

Question: You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
Passengers in your vehicle are 15 years or over. Who is responsible for making sure they wear a safety belt (seat belt)?

Answers.Answer: You as the driver of the vehicle

Question: When must you signal that you are turning to the right?

Answers.Answer: Only if there are vehicles in front of you
3 seconds or more before you turn
Only if there are vehicles following behind you

Question: What should you do when driving in foggy weather?

Answers.Answer: Stay close to the vehicle ahead of you
Turn your vehicle headlights onto dip
Use the centre line as a guide
Turn your vehicle park lights on

Question: What may you do at traffic signals if there is a green arrow pointing to the right and a red light showing at the same time?

Answers.Answer: You must stop until all lights turn green
You may turn left or right

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
How can small amounts of alcohol affect your driving?

Answers.Answer: You can judge your speed more easily
Your driving reactions will be quicker

Question: When passing a horse and rider, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Warn the rider by sounding the horn on your vehicle
Slow down and give them as much room as you can
Warn the rider by turning your vehicle headlights on

Answers.Answer: Stop at the signals if you can do so safely
Speed up before the light changes to red
Stop even if it means stopping in the middle of the intersection
Turn hard to the left and stop around the corner

Question: You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?

What should you do if you meet animals coming towards you on the road?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and move over to the left side of the road
Give a long blast with the horn on your vehicle
Give a lot of short toots with the horn on your vehicle

Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?

Slow down and then drive over the lines

Stop and if no train is coming you may drive over the lines

Question: What is the maximum speed you may drive if you have a ‘space saver wheel’ fitted?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: What should you do if you are driving and become sleepy?

Answers.Answer: Drive on the far left side of the road
Move off to the left of the road and have a rest
Speed up so that you can get home quickly
Keep on driving but use a lower gear

Question: A police officer can impound your car on the spot if you are caught driving while disqualified.

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get around in front of the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist
Stop and give way to the cyclist
